project_description: A simple Flutter application demonstrating the Cubit pattern for state management. The app displays a text with an icon, and switches the text and icon when clicked.
architecture_overview: The project follows a modular architecture with a clear separation of concerns. It uses the Cubit pattern for state management, organizing the code into separate files for models, Cubits, and widgets.

files.name: lib/main.dart
files.description: Entry point of the application. Provides Cubit using BlocProvider and sets up the initial screen.

methods.name: main
methods.description: Main entry point of the application.

files.name: lib/screens/home_screen.dart
files.description: Defines the HomeScreen widget which is the main screen of the application.

files.name: lib/cubits/text_cubit.dart
files.description: Defines the TextCubit which manages the state for the text and icon.

methods.name: toggleText
methods.description: Toggles the text and icon between 'Cat' and 'Dog'.

files.name: lib/models/text_model.dart
files.description: Defines the TextModel which represents the data for the text and icon.

files.name: lib/widgets/text_icon_widget.dart
files.description: Defines the TextIconWidget which displays the text and icon.

widgets.name: HomeScreen
widgets.description: The main screen of the application which displays the TextIconWidget.

widgets.name: TextIconWidget
widgets.description: A widget that displays text with an icon, and toggles the text and icon when clicked.

cubits.name: TextCubit
cubits.description: Manages the state for the text and icon, toggling between 'Cat' and 'Dog'.

models.name: TextModel
models.description: Represents the data for the text and icon.

dependencies.name: flutter_bloc
dependencies.purpose: State management using the Cubit pattern.

dependencies.name: bloc
dependencies.purpose: State management using the Cubit pattern.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen: taps on text
HomeScreen -> TextCubit: toggleText()
TextCubit -> HomeScreen: updates state
HomeScreen -> TextIconWidget: rebuild with new state
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using a Cubit (TextCubit) which holds the current state of the text and icon (TextModel). When the user taps on the text, an event is dispatched to the Cubit to toggle the text and icon. The Cubit updates its state, which triggers a rebuild of the UI to reflect the new state.
navigation_flow: The app consists of a single screen (HomeScreen) which displays a TextIconWidget. There is no navigation to other screens.
